recipesJson.name: Bounty (Abuela de Coco)
recipesJson.author: HerrHut
recipesJson.description:
The Cigar from Abuela¹ mixed with the Coconut from Leche de Coco².  It's a thick heavy creamy coconut cigar.

Mix the originals first, otherwise you're missing out.

I suggest vaping Abuela and this alternately.  You will go "Oh the mango" → "Ooh the coconut" → "Oooh the mango" ∞

¹ https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/47894#abuela_by_fear
² https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/42350#leche_de_coco_coconut_milk_by_hashslingingslashur

reviews.text: I’ve created a lot of werid tobacco combo. Like honeysuckle and tobacco, but coconut and tobacco never crossed my mind. You took 2 recipes I have tried and enjoyed and blended them together & it works well. Them tobacco combo you used from Abuela works really well in here and doesn’t overpower the coconut.

I'll start by saying I lowered the cheesecake graham crust to 0.5% in this (I do the same with leche de coco otherwise I get nothing but graham, my palate is weird). Other than that I mixed this as is, this is a great mash up of two great recipes. I was thinking of what I could sub the mango in Abuela for to make a different vape and the first thing that came to mind was coconut so finding this helped me. It's a great vape, I get the same cigar goodness from Abuela with a light creamy coconut at the back end. I'll definitely be mixing up more of this.
